content:
Sure, here are some quick and easy meals that are healthy and can be made in a college dorm:

1. Overnight oats: Mix rolled oats with milk, yogurt, and your favorite fruits in a jar or bowl and leave it in the fridge overnight. In the morning, you'll have a healthy and filling breakfast ready to eat. 2. Healthy wraps: Use whole wheat tortillas to make wraps filled with roasted vegetables, hummus, and grilled chicken or tofu. 3. Veggie omelet: Whisk eggs with your favorite veggies (bell peppers, onions, spinach, etc.) and cook in a non-stick pan for a healthy and protein-packed breakfast. 4. Bean salad: Combine a can of black beans or chickpeas with veggies like cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion. Add a light dressing of olive oil and lemon juice for flavor. 5. Microwave quinoa bowl: Mix cooked quinoa with steamed veggies and some chopped nuts for a nutritious and filling meal. 6. Smoothie bowl: Blend frozen fruits with yogurt and milk for a quick and easy smoothie bowl topped with granola and fresh fruit. These are just a few examples, but there are many healthy meal options that can be made with limited kitchen equipment and fridge space in a college dorm. Just remember to incorporate fruits, vegetables, and lean proteins into your meals to stay fueled and energized throughout the day.
